Description: SWE-bench Pro evaluates software engineering agents on real-world repository-level tasks that require producing correct patches and passing tests across multiple languages. Compared with SWE-bench Verified, it is designed to be harder and more contamination-resistant, emphasizing realistic debugging, refactoring, and feature implementation under constraints.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Decision-making (minor), Language Comprehension (minor), Language Production (minor)

Description: OSWorld tests multimodal “computer use” agents that must complete tasks in a full operating system environment by interacting with graphical user interfaces (e.g., clicking, typing, navigating apps). Success depends on perceiving screen state, choosing actions over many steps, and recovering from mistakes and unexpected interface states.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Planning, Decision-making, Attention (minor), Working Memory (minor), Sensorimotor Coordination (minor), Adaptive Error Correction (minor)

Description: ARC-AGI is a “fluid intelligence” benchmark where a model infers hidden rules from a few input–output grid examples and applies the rule to a new grid. It is intended to minimize reliance on memorized knowledge, emphasizing abstract pattern induction and generalization from limited demonstrations.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Cognitive Flexibility, Working Memory, Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Spatial Representation & Mapping (minor), Planning (minor)

Description: Vending-Bench 2 evaluates long-horizon agent coherence and strategy in a simulated year-long vending-machine business. Agents must manage inventory, pricing, supplier interactions, and budgeting over thousands of decisions, where early choices compound into later constraints and opportunities.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Reward Mechanisms, Working Memory, Adaptive Error Correction (minor), Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition (minor), Motivational Drives (minor)

Description: MCP-Atlas measures real-world tool-use ability via the Model Context Protocol (MCP), emphasizing selecting appropriate tools, calling them correctly, handling errors, and composing multi-step workflows. Tasks resemble production integration work with authentic APIs and multi-tool dependencies, stressing reliability rather than single-shot QA.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Language Comprehension (minor), Language Production (minor), Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition (minor)

Description: CyberGym evaluates cybersecurity agents on tasks involving identifying known vulnerabilities and discovering new ones in real open-source projects. It emphasizes reasoning over codebases, mapping high-level weakness descriptions to concrete buggy patterns, and proposing effective fixes or exploit-relevant findings.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Working Memory, Decision-making (minor), Language Comprehension (minor)

Description: Humanity’s Last Exam is a difficult multimodal benchmark spanning frontier academic and professional knowledge, designed to stress models on problems near or beyond typical web-level familiarity. Questions often require synthesizing information, performing multi-step reasoning, and integrating text with visual materials.
Cognitive Functions: Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Visual Perception (minor), Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning (minor)

Description: GPQA Diamond is a high-quality subset of graduate-level, “Google-proof” multiple-choice science questions where non-experts typically fail but experts succeed. It targets deep scientific reasoning and careful reading under adversarially difficult distractors.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory (minor), Decision-making (minor), Language Comprehension (minor)

Description: MMMU-Pro is an expert-level multimodal benchmark that extends MMMU with harder questions and evaluation settings to stress robust perception-plus-reasoning. Models must interpret images (e.g., diagrams, charts, screenshots) alongside text and select or generate answers requiring domain knowledge and multi-step inference.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Language Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory (minor), Attention (minor)

Description: OmniDocBench 1.5 evaluates document understanding and OCR pipelines across heterogeneous content such as text, tables, formulas, and reading order. It stresses extracting structured information from visually complex layouts where spatial arrangement and formatting cues are essential.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Spatial Representation & Mapping, Language Comprehension (minor), Visual Attention & Eye Movements (minor), Working Memory (minor)

Description: Video-MMMU evaluates multimodal understanding and reasoning over videos paired with text questions, requiring temporal integration across events and scenes. Tasks emphasize tracking changes over time, attributing actions and causes, and answering questions that depend on multiple moments in the clip.
Cognitive Functions: Visual Perception, Scene Understanding & Visual Reasoning, Working Memory, Attention (minor), Cognitive Timing & Predictive Modeling (minor), Language Comprehension (minor)

Description: LiveCodeBench Pro measures competitive coding ability on fresh, time-sliced programming problems intended to reduce contamination and reward genuine problem solving. It emphasizes writing correct, efficient programs under specification constraints, often requiring algorithm design and iterative debugging.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Planning, Working Memory, Adaptive Error Correction, Language Comprehension (minor), Language Production (minor)

Description: FACTS Benchmark Suite systematically evaluates factuality and grounding behavior across a collection of factuality-related tasks, aiming to capture different ways models can be wrong (e.g., hallucinated details, unsupported claims, or inconsistent attributions). It is designed to move beyond single-score “truthfulness” by probing robustness across scenarios and domains.
Cognitive Functions: Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Language Production, Language Comprehension (minor), Inhibitory Control (minor), Self-reflection (minor)

Description: Global PIQA evaluates commonsense physical reasoning across many languages and cultural contexts using non-parallel items, emphasizing whether models can pick plausible actions or outcomes in everyday situations. It probes robustness of pragmatic understanding beyond English-centric distributions.
Cognitive Functions: Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Logical Reasoning, Language Comprehension, Cognitive Flexibility (minor), Social Reasoning & Theory of Mind (minor)

Description: MRCR v2 (8-needle) is a long-context, multi-round coreference-style retrieval evaluation where multiple similar “needle” requests and responses are embedded in long “haystacks,” and the model must reproduce the correct referenced response. It stresses maintaining and selecting the right context among near-duplicates over very long inputs.
Cognitive Functions: Working Memory, Attention, Episodic Memory, Language Comprehension, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition (minor)

Description: GDPval evaluates economically valuable, well-specified professional knowledge-work tasks across many occupations, judged by expert humans via comparisons to professional outputs. Tasks commonly require producing real artifacts (e.g., spreadsheets, slides, plans) with correct structure, constraints, and trade-offs rather than short-form answers.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Decision-making, Language Production, Semantic Understanding & Context Recognition, Working Memory (minor), Self-reflection (minor), Social Reasoning & Theory of Mind (minor)

Description: SWE-Lancer evaluates agentic software engineering on realistic tasks that demand end-to-end patch development and robustness in a codebase setting, emphasizing reliability and practical workflow completion. It is oriented toward real developer work patterns, including iterating on solutions and handling repository context effectively.
Cognitive Functions: Planning, Adaptive Error Correction, Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Decision-making (minor), Language Comprehension (minor), Language Production (minor)

Description: FrontierMath is a benchmark of advanced mathematics problems intended to measure progress on research-level quantitative reasoning rather than routine textbook manipulation. Problems are designed to be difficult for models and often require multi-step derivations, careful case analysis, and precise symbolic reasoning.
Cognitive Functions: Logical Reasoning, Working Memory, Planning, Cognitive Flexibility (minor), Adaptive Error Correction (minor)
